alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 2:32AM PST until February 25 at 11:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Santa Ynez River At Narrows affecting Santa Barbara County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is now expected to begin between 6 am and 7 am PST this morning due to releases from Lake Cachuma. * WHERE...Santa Ynez River At Narrows. * WHEN...From this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, flooding threatens agricultural land and outlying grounds of federal prison. At 15.0 feet, flooding is a threat to lower Lompoc, especially around Floradale Ave. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 AM PST this morning, the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is now expected to rise to a crest of 18.6 feet around 1 pm PST this afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.0 feet on 02/25/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 230 PM PST.
